page.title: 19DAVID FLETCHER COSA MEMBER
page.content:
During the miners' strike David Fletcher was aged 42 years. His wife works as a secretary. During the strike he took responsibility for his son, getting him ready for school etc. He took a variety of jobs to supplement his income: car repairs, painting,landscape gardening etc.
During the winter he riddled ashes on the council tip 2 mornings a week,he collected 6 tons to take home.
Generous parents gave cooked lunch every week day. He grew his own fruit and vegetables and made his own wine.
No repairs or decorations were carried out in his own house during the strike, due to lack of money. He could not afford to run his car or go on holiday.
